importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The incident occurred on October 19, 2025, and the timeline of the crash and subsequent events is critical for understanding the sequence of events and public response.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The article was updated at 3:23 PM EDT on October 19, 2025, indicating the latest available information on the incident and developments in the investigation.

keyTakeAways: A 66-year-old man from Washington, DC, drove into a birthday party tent in Bladensburg, Maryland, killing one person and injuring 13, including six adults and eight children.
The victim who died was Ashley Hernandez Gutierrez, 31, of Washington, DC.
The driver initially fled the scene on foot but later turned himself in to authorities.
The incident occurred at a child's birthday party where a tent was torn open and partially collapsed due to the impact.
Neighbors reported hearing loud booms, seeing a car driving erratically, and witnessing multiple injuries, with some children appearing to be severely hurt.
A video on X (formerly Twitter) shows police and firefighters responding to the scene early Sunday morning.
One of the children remains hospitalized in stable condition; three adults remain hospitalized in stable condition, one is awaiting treatment, and one has been released.
Jocelyn Route, a former Prince George’s County school board member and Bladensburg council member, provided a firsthand account of the crash, describing the chaos and injuries.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A 66-year-old man from Washington, DC, drove into a birthday party tent in Bladensburg, Maryland, killing 31-year-old Ashley Hernandez Gutierrez and injuring 13 others, including six adults and eight children. The driver fled the scene on foot but later turned himself in. Neighbors, including former Bladensburg council member Jocelyn Route, reported hearing explosions and seeing severe injuries. A video posted on X shows the aftermath, with emergency responders arriving at the scene. Victims include a child in stable condition and three adults still hospitalized. The incident highlights critical issues in road safety, emergency response, and community awareness.
title: Driver plows into child’s birthday party in Maryland, killing 1 and injuring 13, turns himself in
